intro: Kaempferia versicolor, commonly known as the rainbow ginger, is a tropical ornamental plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and related plants. The plant features lush, broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often a deep green with a metallic sheen. Its flowers are showy, with brightly colored petals that can range from white to pink, red, and purple, creating a striking visual display. Kaempferia versicolor is typically grown as a decorative plant in gardens and greenhouses due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
